Reviews.Author: Ali Julia

} // ]]> var cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0RollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0RollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71nWmivaLvS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0preplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0preplayImageId'); if (cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0preplay) { cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0preplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71nWmivaLvS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0preplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71nWmivaLvS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0preplay.parentNode; var cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0currentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0currentClick) { return cv_mo1RK2AISGDDTF0currentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:05 MinsIn case someone reads just the first few lines of this review, let me start by saying that the technical specs for this tablet under Amazon product description contain several errors, the main one being the number of cores in the processor of this tablet. I note the errors and corrections at the end of the review and I notified the seller.As a background for this review, I am a fairly heavy tablet user. We own three tablets: Nexus 7, Galaxy 7.7, and iPad Mini which we use for navigation, music streaming, game playing, reading, browsing, listening to internet radio and so forth. I received Pyle Astro Tablet from the manufacture for testing, evaluation and review. In my review I will compare my experiences with these tablets, especially the Android tablets, to Pyle Astro Tablet.Given the price difference between the tablets (the Pyle Astro Tablets is under $100 at the time I am writing this review) any comparison must start with a price. Pyle Astro Tablet is less than half of the cheapest tablet listed above. It is a real bargain. The question is what are the main practical differences between the Pyle Astro Tablet and the other three tablets I mentioned.✔ 1. The display resolution (which is 800 x 480) and brightness. In practical terms it means that even though Pyle tablet has a larger physical screen it will fit less on the screen than a display with a higher resolution. Reduced brightness means it is harder to read in the bright sun. I found that the image on the screen looks washed out at more angles than my other tablets. However, if you hold the tablet at the right angle and not in the bright sun the screen is acceptable. This is the biggest difference, and given the price difference it is a reasonable compromise.I am attaching a collage of 2 photos, showing Pyle Astro tablet next to Galaxy 7.7 tablet (which has screen resolution 1280 x 800 pixels) so you can compare the display.✔ 2. The processor of this tablet is not as powerful as the processors in my other tablets. It also comes with a relatively small amount memory (512MB). In practical terms it means it is a bit more sluggish than the tablets I compared it to. Doing the same operation on Pyle Astro Tablet and Galaxy 7.7 tablet (which runs the same version of the operating system) Pyle tablet took longer. To be specific, things take longer to display. For example, when I need to enter something the on-screen keyboard takes a bit longer to appear than with the other tablets. When I install something it takes a bit longer and so forth.✔ 3. This tablet does not have a bluetooth capability. In my day-to-day usage of the tablets I use bluetooth quite a bit. I use bluetooth speaker when we use the tablet to navigate, for streaming music or audio books. I also use a bluetooth keyboard when I am doing a lot of typing on my tablet during travel. Whether missing bluetooth functionality is a deal breaker depends on whether you plan to use bluetooth devices.✔ 4. The tablet is running Android 4.0.4 operating system. I tested many of the apps I use on my Galaxy 7.7 tablet and most of the worked with the exception of TuneIn Radio which gave me a message that it is not compatible with this device. Surprising! Pandora radio did work just fine. The error tells me that there is a potential that some apps will not work on this tablet even when they work with other tablets running Android 4.0.4.✔ 5. I found the touch screen to be a little less responsive than my other tablets. Perhaps this could be explained by the slower processor rather than the screen itself. However, the responsiveness of the touch screen is something that you get used to and learn to use effectively relatively quickly.With the price tag of under $100 Pyle Astro tablet performed rather well for a budget tablet. Whether you are on a budget or want to get a tablet for youngster this tablet will do a serviceable job.================================================Technical specification errors as of 6/11/2013================================================I am an engineer so several mistakes in the technical spec jumped out at me and caused me to look for another version of the spec, which I found on the Pyle Audio web site. This second version of the spec appears to be accurate. I am including that version after noting the errors.1. Errors in the manufacture and processor description.Processor Brand: IntelProcessor: 1.2 GHz A-Series Quad-Core A8➨ ➨ A8 is an ARM processor and Intel does not make ARM processors at the current time➨ ➨ The processor in this tablet is unlikely to be a high end quad-core based on performance and price of this tablet.When I looked up the processor on the Pyle web site, the processor was descried as "1.2GHz Cortex A8 Processor Chip"not mentioning the number of cores, which typically implies one core.2. Hard Drive Rotational Speed 5400 RPM➨ ➨ Tablets do not use hard drives that rotate, they use flash RAM3. Hard Drive 8 GB➨ ➨ This device does not have a hard drive, it has is 8GB flash RAM storage capacityThe difference between hard drives and flash RAM is that hard drives are mechanical devices that rotate, flash RAM is solid state memory (no moving parts). This makes flash RAM shockproof, which makes it very useful for a mobile device which is being carried around. If this tablet actually had a hard drive it would be bad news. But the spec from Pyle web site does not include a mention of the hard drive and refers to 8GB Storage Capacity instead.==========================================Here is the spec from the Pyle web site==========================================Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Operating System)1.2GHz Cortex A8 Processor Chip with 3D Graphic Acceleration2 Built-in Cameras: .3 Megapixel Front & 2 Megapixel Back CamerasMulti-Touch Capacitive Screen with 4-Direction Gravity SensingHigh-Speed Wireless Network: 802.11 b/g/nTF card Port (Supports up to 32GB)8GB Storage CapacityIntegrated Flash PlayerMulti Language Support512MB DDR3 RAMPixel Resolution: 800 x 480Up to 8-Hour Battery Life (4000mAh Battery)Headphone Jack & Side-Button Volume ControlUSB wall charger adapter, USB charging cableAli Julia review
Reviews.Title: Pyle tablet does a serviceable job. Comparison with other tablets included

Reviews.Author: Noname
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFO', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; var swfWidth = "320"; var swfHeight = "100%"; var flashVersion = "9.0.115"; var bgColor = "#FFFFFF"; var swfParams = {}; var flashParams = {}; var embedAttributes = {}; swfParams.amazonPort = "80"; swfParams.allowFullScreen = "true"; } cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOloadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFORollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFORollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81Kb9dtLAgS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOpreplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOpreplayImageId'); if (cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOpreplay) { cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOpreplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81Kb9dtLAgS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81Kb9dtLAgS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOcurrentClick) { return cv_mo1P7SPF5OMRLFOcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 2:11 MinsFor a tablet that sells for less than $100, the Astro is serious competition to the more expensive Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet.But wow. The Astro can do so much more. It is the same length, but slightly narrower, with a similar size viewing area (Astro: 7 ¾" x 4 3/8"; Fire: 7 ½" x 4 ¾"). It has a micro SD slot (none in the Fire), and a front and rear-facing camera (only front-facing for the Fire).I can customize it so much more easily, starting with the desktop (reminds me of my Windows desktop) and the addition of some cool wallpaper. The wallpapers included could be ordinary, or like the one I used, super-extraordinary. It's 3-D: leaves falling on water with a reflection of the tree above. The water ripples in response to our touch. Amazing.Screen responsiveness is good. Occasionally, it sticks or lags but not a problem enough to put a dent in my enjoyment.The rear camera casts a bit of a shadow from the case along the left side of the image. Still, that's better than no rear camera (i.e., Kindle Fire). The front camera suffers no obstructions. Photos and videos come in clear.The first thing I did was load up all the apps I bought for my Kindle Fire from the Amazon App store. Most of them work on this Android. It's so nice that I don't have to buy them all over again. I then went to Google Play to load up on more apps. I like having two stores to choose from.All the apps work exactly as they should. I don't have problems with the unit crashing.Of course, the Fire does score points in some areas. Connecting to Wi-Fi on the Astro takes a little patience. I solved that problem by setting the Astro to always be connected, even when sleeping. That way, I don't have to wait for the Wi-Fi to turn on.The video is not as vibrant and is sometimes more pixilated than on the Fire. Honestly, I only noticed the depth of color because I'm comparing them for a review.Sound is not as full and somewhat tinny on the Astro, but I don't use tablets for music. It is plenty adequate for the browsing and games that I do. With an earphone, the sound is much better.Battery life is very good. I can play on it for hours at a time. Considering Wi-Fi is always on, even when sleeping, I am impressed. When compared to the Fire, I don't notice myself recharging any more often than usual.PROS:+ forward and rear-facing cameras+ micro SD slot+ Android OS, fully customizable+ comes with screen protector installed+ excellent value for the money (less than $100 as of this writing)+ screen is responsive, great performance (good for surfing, games, email, apps)+ smaller than the Fire HD 8.9" tablet, but about the same viewing area+ good battery life+ Wi-Fi capableCONS:- sound is not full, a little tinny, much better with earphones- video not as rich as more expensive systems but I consider it more than good enough for most applications- couldn't test micro SD card (Astro said card was defective, but it works on PC)- micro SD card easily inserted wrong, easily falls out when inserted correctly.- rear-facing camera casts a shadow on the lens- lacks BluetoothYes, I own the Fire HD. I love it. Amazon is my friend. If I wasn't such an Amazon devotee, I'd buy the Astro in a heartbeat. It's an amazing value for the price, and in many ways, it beats the Fire. I feel like a traitor saying that.I'd most definitely buy the Astro for my kids. As a matter of fact, my kids use this and my original Kindle Fire to play Minecraft against (with?) each other. The Astro doesn't come with parental controls installed, but there's an app for that. I use Kapersky. It's free.The kids say performance is exactly the same as the original Kindle Fire. They are perfectly happy with the Astro. I am, too.This product was provided for review by the Max Borges Agency.________________UPDATE 8/16/13: Per request, I installed CPU Info and got the following results (I really have no clue what most of it means):** ACPU freq: 1.2 GHz** Processor: ARMv7 Processor rev 2 (v71)** BoboMIPS: 1001.88** Features: swp half thumb fastmult vfp edsp neon vfpv3** CPU implementer: 0x41** CPU architecture: 7** CPU variant: 0x3** CPU part: 0xc08** CPU revision: 2** Hardware: sun5i** Revision: a13b________________________UPDATE 1/5/14: I do not normally use a micro SD card, so the card falling out was not a problem for me. I did realize recently that the micro SD card won't mount. Since I do not rely on micro SD, this is not a problem for me. If you need to use micro SD, it may be a problem for you.
Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the money

Reviews.Author: Tommy Shields
Reviews.Content: The first day I got the tablet, I was really excited to have it and use it. I installed all my favorite apps on it that night. Unfortunately, I powered it down overnight, and when I turned it on, it told me that some of my critical apps didn't work, and the entire tablet crashed several times. Furious, I tried uninstalling and reinstalling the apps, but to no avail.Finally, I got so frustrated, I performed a factory reset and only installed only a few apps, including the ones that didn't work before. After the factory reset, everything works like a charm. After a week of use, it has yet to malfunction on me, and the battery lasts for an incredible length of time.If you are initially frustrated by this tablet, try a factory reset. It completely solved my problems, you may have some similar luck. Don't give up on it right away.
Reviews.Title: Needs some tinkering, but totally worth the price.

Reviews.Author: Bubba
Reviews.Content: I recevied this tablet today and want to use it to serve music over a bluetooth wireless connection to a remote amplifier.  Although the Amazon website images show that it supposed to be Bluetooth enabled (a key requirement) the tablet does not appear to be Bluetooth enabled as there is no Bluetooth section within the System Settings. No reference in the manual either. No listing of Bluetooth in any text description.  Only the words in the image/figure.  Similar problems with data at the Pyle web page. I am relatively new to Android, and I might be wrong, but I think it is missing Bluetooth hardware. I am returning this to Amazon for a refund.  Very dissapointing as I paid for two day shipping only to find it was apparently misrepresented.Otherwise it seemed like a solid tablet and a good value for the money.  I own three iPads and a Galaxy Tab 2 and although this is not as good as those devices it was impressive at the low price.
Reviews.Title: OK Tablet - Appears to not include Bluetooth

Reviews.Author: Thanh Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Great tablet. I can't belive it is $100. Tablet works right out of the box.  Above my expectation. No problem with internet connection. No issues with downloading apps. Charger is working fine. Recommend the product.
Reviews.Title: Pyle Astro PTBL9C 9-Inch 8 GB Tablet

Reviews.Author: Angel V.
Reviews.Content: Product is nice if you want it for your kid(s). It freezes at times and is somewhat slow.( I mean is not as slow as a tar serum). But its a great product to practice with, before buying a nice $399+. Screen resolution is nice, great price but do not expect a A+ performance. Remember what you paying for friends! but I am satisfied.
Reviews.Title: It's Nice..

Reviews.Author: Kathy Lazalde
Reviews.Content: I am not real familiar with tablets, but this one is doing a great job for me. I only rated it a 4 because I'm still learning to use it. I would recommend it to anyone who isn't looking for High Grade technology, but it would be great for a learner. I am hoping to learn to use it better so I can enjoy it more.
Reviews.Title: It seems to be just what I was looking for!

Reviews.Author: Patrick Mayers
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet as a gift and the recipient really love it, the only problem encountered so far is there aren't any drivers available online to transfer ebooks from the computer to this table.
Reviews.Title: Pyle astro tablet

Reviews.Author: Deven Defontaine
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent tablet for the price it is. It works excellently and has an great battery life of like 5 hours. It's pretty fast, You can put most apps on this.  I was very impressed about this item. I'd strongly recommend it to anyone.
Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet

Reviews.Author: Medea Japaridze
Reviews.Content: Very good product, pretty cheep and quite high quality. My son loves it and plays with it all the time. I recommend to buy.
Reviews.Title: Pyle Astro

Reviews.Author: its over
Reviews.Content: The pyle astro is a nice tablet well worth the money that you pay for it, its a lightweight tablet with good graphic smooth game play. you average about 4 to 5 hour battery time on a single charge longer if your not playing games  listening to music or watching videos.it is a great affordable starter tablet, good for the kids ,or just as a second tablet when you don't want to carry that kindle or widows around with you because you don't want it to hit the floor and watch that money go by by the only problems that I have had with the pyle is that it doesn't have blue tube the camera isn't A1(get the aviary app for that)and it slows down if you put to much on the internal storage( get a 16 MB or more memory chip and you should be good to go. I liked the pyle so much for the price that I brought two. The only other advise the I can give you is to deal with amazon directly whenever possible because they treat  their customers right.  (I GAVE IT A 4  FOR THE QUALITY AND THE PRICE)
Reviews.Title: WELL WORTH THE MONEY

Reviews.Author: Greg Anshutz "PR4MNCE-S10"
Reviews.Content: Of the few reviews i could find on this tablet only a few were good, so I'm adding to those good reviews. I have yet to have a problem since I received it. it does everything i need it to from games, music, movies and internet browsing. So far the only lag I've experienced with it was on WiFi other than that the unit itself is pretty quick. I'm looking to buy a couple more for my parents to use.
Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet

Reviews.Author: Tory Trisch
Reviews.Content: This product met all of our expectations including user friendly for our grandson and the price was lower than anywhere else.
Reviews.Title: Great product.....Great price!

Reviews.Author: Michelle Byford
Reviews.Content: For someone who has never had a tablet, this one is perfectly fine.  Loved mine so much, this one was for mother in law's birthday. She loves it.
Reviews.Title: Great product.

Reviews.Author: ravenzglow
Reviews.Content: The tablet is exactly what I expected  however a little more information on the use of it could have been added, but as far as everything else I am very happy with it, the price was within my budget and the features such as the front and rear camera is what I was looking for in a tablet , I looked at a lot of them and they only came with one sided camera.I am enjoying it very much!
Reviews.Title: Tablet.pyle astro 9 inch

Reviews.Author: bradbucker
Reviews.Content: This is a quality tablet.  I needed an Android device to control my Chromecast and help me get acquainted with the Android OS.  The tablet was represented correctly on the information page.  Everything is here; working bluetooth, android 4.0.4 installed, 1.2 ghz cpu, 8gb flash memory, and 512 mb ram.  The touch screen is as responsive as an iPhone 4, just slightly slower than my iPhone 5.  Google play is preinstalled and quite nice.  I've had no issues with crashing either.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet!!

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: We ought this for our 6 year old for his birthday. Works well, does basic things just fine. The battery life is really short and it seems that the homescreen is just to big for the screen with no way to adjust the setting.There is lots of having to scroll side to side when trying to read something.
Reviews.Title: Ok for younger users

Reviews.Author: Shawnette Robinson
Reviews.Content: Its a good tablet and I'm very pleased with it. I really like it. It has good speed when surfing the web and downloading things.
Reviews.Title: Pyle Astro tablet

Reviews.Author: Adam paulson
Reviews.Content: I really like it when it works. Big if though!  I started writing this review on it and it froze.  It freezes all of the time.  Can't get through any projects without it freezing.
Reviews.Title: freezes

Reviews.Author: kkfrench
Reviews.Content: Worked fine 'til one day it just stopped, screen went white to gray to black complete with a line across the bottom... now nothing at all.  What a piece of crap, DO NOT BUY THIS TABLET!!
Reviews.Title: Broke within a month

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for myself. I have a few laptops but wanted something small yet large enough for taking notes and reading news on the go. I did not want to spend a lot of money. This is the perfect item. I do not have a smart phone so learning  to use it is fun and some what time costly but not as much as I expected. I use it a lot for email and reading also searching.  This product is all its intended and more. I compared it to the Samsung Galaxy and found that the only difference is the product name. Out side of the cost. This product gives the galaxy a run for its money. I would buy this again and find no need to expand anything to it. I just use this product more and each day
Reviews.Title: Wow Great Tablet for the Money

Reviews.Author: AlienMindTrick "AlienMindTrick"
Reviews.Content: I called Pyle; this tablet has a Cortex A8 single-core processor. It DOES NOT have a quad-core processor, nor is the processor made by either Intel or AMD.
Reviews.Title: Wrong specs in ad!

Reviews.Author: Mary Beth Adkison "bookaholic"
Reviews.Content: I love my new pyle astro! It does everything & does it well! great battery life too. I had purchased a tablet a few yrs ago & was extremely disappointed so was worried when I bought this Iwould be again, but instead I am delighted!
Reviews.Title: everything I hoped for

Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: This was Xmass gift for my daughter and she really uses it a lot. Great value  for the price! Nice.
Reviews.Title: Great value for the price

Reviews.Author: JDOGG
Reviews.Content: As the title says, yes it does work. for the price of this tablet. it should be used for younger children, who are patient and are not violent with things. I say this because 80 bucks is pretty darn cheap for a modern day dinosaur, about to be taken out by  a comet.It has been able to download all apps and run them, doing an ok job. The mini SD card option is a great feature. it has all the same features one can expect from major name brands. Though I can not give it a five star simply because the speed is more like a Pug vs a Greyhound. It is way too slow, but then again for 80 dollars what else can you expect.Battery life is not a concern, though it drains fast, even when standing idle. I let it sit overnight at 98 percent, 8 hours later it was at 42 percent. it seems to drain fast, I got about 4 hours of stright usage on a full charge, but that is kind of what I expected from non name brand.Overall, if you want Speed, Quality, and all the bells and whistles, go with name brand. but this would be great for kids, who are just stepping into the world of tech. they can get all the practice on this. that way yours wont be destroyed.
Reviews.Title: Well it works

Reviews.Author: David Martin
Reviews.Content: this is a good tablet for just watching movies or playing simple games.  i dislike the file manager though and because of its very limited RAM it struggles to do 2 things at once.  excellent value for the price and would definately recommend it
Reviews.Title: overall useful

Reviews.Author: Vince S.
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old daughter loves this. Haven't experienced any problems other than you have to get used to the sensors on the screen. Not as responsive as my cell phone, and a little slower to type on, but works perfectly. Great buy for the money and a first time tablet.
Reviews.Title: Great For Beginner.

Reviews.Author: Eric Tweiten
Reviews.Content: We've only had it a few weeks, but so far my daughter loves it. No issues with freezing like there seems to be in other reviews. Lots of room for all kinds of apps. It's proving itself to be a great educational tool. Great deal for less than a hundred bucks.
Reviews.Title: Great value!

Reviews.Author: P.T.
Reviews.Content: The price mark down is greatly over estimated.The support for the firmware is nonexistent.For the same price you can find tablets with better specs.
Reviews.Title: False advertising!

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Got this for my Nephew for Christmas and he is totally happy with his gift !Great price and good looking item !
Reviews.Title: Pyle Astro 9in Tablet

Reviews.Author: HolWil
Reviews.Content: The Pyle AStro was everything we were looking for in a tablet. it had all the features we needed. Delivery was fast and prompt.
Reviews.Title: Everything we wanted.

Reviews.Author: Noah Bryant
Reviews.Content: I bought three of these tablets for Christmas to my three boys. They have been enjoying them ever since. It goes of the standard Gmail account and I was able to plug my cell account on each of them to download games and apps for free. I do suggest purchasing protective sleeves and screen protectors though.Noah BryantSpanaway Washington
Reviews.Title: Kids Love It

Reviews.Author: Ernesto Acevedo
Reviews.Content: I've been pleasantly surprised by how well this device has worked so far. It's easy to use, the Wi-Fi works well, I can access the internet, watch youtube videos, email, download large files and email with ease. It performs all the basics fine. However, I can't sync with my PC, but I can transfer photos directly from my camera with ease, but I haven't been able to figure how to transfer videos. The built in cams are so bad that it just about shouldn't have them, and it does not have bluetooth. It does have a large screen and is great for indoor use.
Reviews.Title: Works great, especially for the price.

Reviews.Author: Jose
Reviews.Content: The reason why I am giving this product 4 out of 5 stars is because the wall charger went bad on the second day of being in use. The tablet itself is a great tablet. Not to mention is has a very big screen.
Reviews.Title: Good Tablet

Reviews.Author: Ilovetech
Reviews.Content: It is slow. Within the first 2 weeks of having it, the screen froze. It would not turn off. I had to wait until the battery died. When I was able to use it again I put it back to factory mode. It is slow even after I put it back to factory mode.
Reviews.Title: Don't buy

Reviews.Author: heswefner
Reviews.Content: I used it and it works well for the money.Figuring out how the amazon 4.0 works is the hardest. With no manual to speak of ,its all trial and error
Reviews.Title: A tablet at a good price

Reviews.Author: Harry Simpson
Reviews.Content: I actually bought the tablet to read.  Not a very good selection ,( I haven't read anything as yet).  Web functions are fine. My favorite game does not function on the tablet, although it does on my Android phone.  I find myself using my smart phone more than the tablet and I bought it for the opposite reason! Oh well, go figure !!!  The user manual is a joke!!
Reviews.Title: Review of Pyle Astro PTB9C

Reviews.Author: L. N. Peccina
Reviews.Content: I know its 100 bucks and it great for a kid but the screen was okay as far as features it has what you need but its not a quad core as listed its a very slow single core tablet. okay but not for me
Reviews.Title: For the money its not bad but it was very slow

Reviews.Author: candi pollitt
Reviews.Content: I have been unable to find a driver download, which means I have been unable to connect my table to transfer pics and other files. I got it pretty cheap I thought, maybe thats why? IDK. Also!!!!!!!! Every time I turn it on, it takes about 3-5 mins for it to load due to all the pop ups for apps the dont work. Im not sure what that is about. I have had it for about 3-5 months.
Reviews.Title: NO DRIVER

Reviews.Author: Michael Kast
Reviews.Content: The specs above do not meet the tablet I was sent when I ordered this tablet. The tablet I have DOES look exactly like this but the internal hardware is actually an Allwinner allseries 1.2ghs SINGLE CORE CPU!!! It has a mali400 SINGLE CORE GPU and 512MB of only DDR1 RAM!!! I'm not sure if it was a mixup in shipping or maybe they are just trying to rip people off, but I wouldn't order this tablet until they can actually send the advertised tablet!
Reviews.Title: False Advertising!

Reviews.Author: MSMW
Reviews.Content: This tablet was a real piece of junk. It stopped working on the same day that I received it in the mail. You turn it on and it turns right back off. You couldn't do anything on it. Please buy a different one than this.
Reviews.Title: save your money

Reviews.Author: Mrugank
Reviews.Content: I bought this product, it arrived, un-boxed it in hopes to be good.It started, but as soon as i started the camera, the tablet got freezed. Couldnt not even restart.Later on using it, i found that it is very slow and hangs up now and then..i would suggest not to buy this product. Its a waste of money. There are more better options available in this section.
Reviews.Title: Waste of money!!

Reviews.Author: patel
Reviews.Content: what i say about this tablet ? i can't say it's a great tablet or even good tablet ,i can say it is ok, not bad but have to be work smooth,it freez after some time,specker need to improve,hadphone jack really cheap,look wise also ok,i returned,and buy samsung 10.2 ,great tablet no complain....
Reviews.Title: need to lot improvment

Reviews.Author: roadrunnermoore
Reviews.Content: Have had nothing but problems since I bought it. Mainly, it sometimes goes for days without detecting a wifi connection. There appears to be no way to reset your network connections, the Pyle website has no info, the manual that came with it is no help.  I would spend a few extra dollars and get a quality name brand product. Lesson learned.
Reviews.Title: Spend a little extra

Reviews.Author: Joseph S. Kennedy "yardman"
Reviews.Content: It keeps suggesting that I download apps that it then says aren't supported by the system.  Browser keeps 'unresponding' and I use the 'report' button too often.  Sure, I can read email, go to facebook & get the weather but I had hoped for more from this machine.  I only paid $89 for it and bought it because fo the "Pyle" name.  For another $100, I could have had a better purchase
Reviews.Title: Not up to snuff

Reviews.Author: Mary Lou
Reviews.Content: I received this tablet from 1saleaday.com and it is dead. Try to charge it and it wouldn't charge. 1saleaday.com told me to call the manufacture. Try to call the manufacture and all you get from them is: Sorry we are close, leave a message, sorry our mailbox is full. Try 3 difference times for 3 days. 1saleaday.com is refunding my money.
Reviews.Title: Won't charge, Won't start

Reviews.Author: Wesley Harris
Reviews.Content: I bought this for myself and I love it. It was easy to set up. Battery life is good. Screen is responsive. Great value for the price.
Reviews.Title: I love mine!!!!

Reviews.Author: JOHN ALEXANDER MITROVITCH BENAVIDES
Reviews.Content: WHAT IS A EXCELLENT PRODUCT RECOMMEND ALL MY EXPECTATIONS FULFILLED IF POSSIBLE AND WE REQUIRE IN THE FUTURE, buy it AGAIN willingly, TIMELY YOUR CARDS ENTTREGA SELLER
Reviews.Title: WHAT IS A EXCELLENT PRODUCT RECOMMEND ALL MY EXPECTATIONS FULFILLED IF POSSIBLE AND WE REQUIRE IN THE FUTURE, buy it AGAIN willi

Reviews.Author: Cory Gene Newport "bushlaff"
Reviews.Content: I have had it for about 8months.  I don't use very often but seems to work just fine.  Kind of slow processing...could be my wifi.  I don't have any other problems with wifi on my laptop or phone.  I think it is the actual tablet.  Nontheless it works fine.  Great tablet for the price.
Reviews.Title: Good so far

Reviews.Author: Susan Mahoney
Reviews.Content: Not a user friendly tablet. Have a real hard time using at home & away from home. Do not like this one at all.
Reviews.Title: not user friendly, do not like it.

Reviews.Author: Nathan Clifford
Reviews.Content: Don't do it. You get what you pay for i guess. This thing is god awful. It's slow makes a constant loud ticking sound. Only can hear out of one side of the headphones that are plugged in.
Reviews.Title: awful

Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: The Pyle Astro is like a box of chocolates. You never know what you are going to get next.  It just does not behave the way it should.  Not reliable.
Reviews.Title: Erratic behavior

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: This tablet is what you would expect for the price. The touchscreen has a delay and isn't very accurate. It is kinda slow. But I bought it for my 11 yr old daughter for Christmas whom I expected to just have fun with it and not use it for anything important. I would never buy a child any piece of technology more expensive than this anyway because, as I assumed would happen, she has already cracked the screen. But I also bought the replacement plan that was marketed alongside it so I will review that company's performance separately. As long as you go into the purchase knowing you are getting what you pay for and that it won't be anything special, just a platform for some simple games, checking email and social media, etc. then it is a fine purchase.
Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for

Reviews.Author: Alexey Petrusenko
Reviews.Content: Slow boot, slow app start up, some apps does not work correctly e.g. Skype. Hard for working touch screen....But for this price i'm not surprised.
Reviews.Title: Very slow

Reviews.Author: Joseph Hernandez
Reviews.Content: One of the worst if not the worst tablet out....please do not waste your time by buying the pyle astro....wish i saw a comment like this so i didnt waste mine..
Reviews.Title: think twice read this review

Reviews.Author: tim armstrong
Reviews.Content: Good first tablet. It suprised  me.  I ordered a keyboard case for it and they work great together. Trying to get another one.
Reviews.Title: works great

Reviews.Author: Victor Sanford "mmoplayer"
Reviews.Content: it worked fine til i broke it accidentally 5 days later.......have to find a printer so i can send it back and apparently get my money back instead of it replaced...........would rather of had it replaced not a refund
Reviews.Title: Pyle Astro

Reviews.Author: Ramon Borjas III
Reviews.Content: Would not work after one week, runs very slow and not many apps compatible. If you are looking for a paper weight you found it.
Reviews.Title: Junk

Reviews.Author: Keith Vaughan
Reviews.Content: I absolute fell in love with it in just a few days.This tablet is easy to use and is very responsive and light weight.You can upload videos in an instant with this tablet.I would not hesitate to buy second fora christmas gift.
Reviews.Title: This tablet is something else

Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Cheap, easy to use and efficient.  I would purchase this product for anyone who just wants a tablet to mess around on
Reviews.Title: Gift for wife

Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: Had to send the first one back because the sound did not turn off when the headphones were plugged in and that the battery didn't fully charge.  Have had the second one for a month or so and although it doesnt have the issues the first one did, the battery doesn't last for 8 hours no matter what I use it for.  Just under 3 hours is the longest it has lasted at any point in time.Otherwise it does work for the things I need it to.  Would recomend you get a SD card at the same time to extend the memory and put any aps that you are not going to use on a regular basis on the card.
Reviews.Title: It is what it is

Reviews.Author: cristian
Reviews.Content: Very good product, my Little girls are very happy with this, they love it !!Good for make their homeworks from school.
Reviews.Title: Very good.

Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: The produc came with the speaker damage and i can return because it was a present... terrible present.Don buy it.
Reviews.Title: Terrible mistake

Reviews.Author: Jamie Whitaker
Reviews.Content: It's junk , the battery doesn't last it's hardly been used & it's already messed up! I've not contacted the seller or entered the warranty yet . But curious to what & how they will make this a more pleasant experience ! Time will tell
Reviews.Title: Pyle 9" waste of my money

Reviews.Author: Vicki Theriault
Reviews.Content: For the $ I certainly can't complain.  The perfect more economical option for travelling and being flung around inside backpacks.
Reviews.Title: Perfect for the kids

Reviews.Author: Teresa Sharkey
Reviews.Content: The tablet worked great except that when using the headphones/earbuds you could only hear music, but not the person singing.  We tried several pairs with the same result.  I returned it.
Reviews.Title: Problems

Reviews.Author: Robert Manton
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves it......Says it works well just the sound is not loud enough..shut off button in wrong place, other wise great tablet
Reviews.Title: Astro tablet

Reviews.Author: David Joyce
Reviews.Content: Tablet works pretty well despite being a bit glitchy on hi-processing apps. The largest draw back is the issue I have turning it on. The tablet sometimes requires me to press the power button a few times...maybe it's something internal? It gets the job done though...
Reviews.Title: It's got its flaws...

Reviews.Author: JENNA PARKMAN
Reviews.Content: ITS SO SLOW I SPENT 15 DOLLARS ON A GAME THAT LAGS THE WHOLE TIME YOU PLAY IT AND ANY OTHER APP LAGS TOO. BUT IT WAS ONLY 90 BUCKS SO I GUESS YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. CANT EXPECT MUCH WHEN YOU PAY THAT FOR A TABLET WHEN THEY ARE USUALLY 200.00
Reviews.Title: SLOWEST TABLET EVER ( BUT YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR)

Reviews.Author: David Freeth
Reviews.Content: it does not work as good as apple i pad very slow to respond and not always compatible with British apps
Reviews.Title: Pyle astro

Reviews.Author: sena
Reviews.Content: This "pyle" of crap broke Christmas day. Boo hoo. Cant fix it at a repair place either, i have to send it back. Hope i can get my money back.
Reviews.Title: really bad

Reviews.Author: JGT
Reviews.Content: This tablet was purchased as a gift.  It keeps freezing up and restarting itself.  It will most likely be returned.
Reviews.Title: Pyle Astro PTBL9C Tablet

Reviews.Author: Dillon Stenberg "Dill"
Reviews.Content: Please read this recent review. I was trying to find a perfect cheap tablet in the market and I ordered this item finally after looking at millions of them. First of all it only has 512 MB or RAM. This means it will be SLOWWWWWWWWW! That is really its only downfall. Everything else about it is amazing but sadly because of the fact that its RAM is so slow it can not operate anything. I was thinking about using this as a second mobile computer, HELL NO. If you are going to get a tablet MAKE SURE it has AT LEAST 1 GB of RAM, I think that is a good starting point! Or spend about 50 bucks more on a 10 inch I saw that has 1 GB RAM. Just please don't waste the time or energy to send it back and wait for your refund. I was trying to be open minded but it doesn't work
Reviews.Title: Please do not waste your time or money.

Reviews.Author: Deanne A.
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son and he loves it. It met all my expectations. Good quality, my son loves it.
Reviews.Title: It met all expectations

Reviews.Author: Rale
Reviews.Content: First of the specifications are of by a long shot it's an Allwinner A13 cortex a8 single core processor and the gpu is a Mali 400mp. This doesn't sound bad for the price huh? Hmm 9 inch screen with resolution of 800 by 432 yeah weird but the viewing angles were fine on it thanks to the 160 dpi screen, now if only the tablet didn't overheat. Don't get ahead of me it's not only overheating but it freezes more often than any tablet I ever reviewed. I tried to watch Netflix think again, after about 10 minutes in to the movie the tablet seemed super hot and not a minute after that it froze up on me, I had to shut it down by holding the power button for like 5 seconds. I like the form of it, it's easily held with one hand but the fact of it is, It's a cheap tablet and by that you can assume that the build quality is horrible where you would be right because you can't even touch the back of that thing without creating smudges on the screen. It comes rooted it has No Bluetooth capabilities the cameras are both horrifyingly bad, I mean the worst I have seen. Skype was something else in a bad way, I could barely be made out or recognized the mic is bad.  Ok the reason I said where do I start is because everything on this darned thing was either bad or it barely worked. It can run games like angry birds but make sure that your kids wear something to avoid being burned. I will be fair and say that I may have been an unfortunate customer and received the lemon of the line but you find out for yourself. I hope that this was helpful if you like it try it just like I did but don't get burned :-D.
Reviews.Title: Man where do I start?

Reviews.Author: Janet Selby
Reviews.Content: I ordered three of these for my children for Christmas and have already had to send two of them back because they froze.  The first one my daughter took a couple of pictures and it froze before Christmas morning was up.  The second my son only used a couple of days and it froze up.  Would not recommend.
Reviews.Title: not good

Reviews.Author: Pablo E Fuentes M
Reviews.Content: It was good time for delivery, but quality of item is objectionable.. Battery for This table endures maximun 4 hours, and you can not be able to use it while it is charging.. The table can not be turn on if not is complete charged.. I do not recommend this product..
Reviews.Title: transaction so so

Reviews.Author: Bwise
Reviews.Content: I  ordered this tablet because of the reasonable price. I wanted to teach myself to use an android tablet. I am an IPad person......much easier. Android is complicated. Good tablet for this purpose.
Reviews.Title: Its ok

Reviews.Author: military  expert in killing
Reviews.Content: the tablet was broken when it arrived to me i cant beileve that i spent 100 dollars on this. this was the worst purchase i ever made
Reviews.Title: broke

Reviews.Author: Carol T
Reviews.Content: My sister just bought each of us one of these. They were cheap grade of plastic, resolution is something like 800 x 400 (very poor)....we reviewed specs and this info was buried........they were very slow on startup and both kept freezing.  My sister could barely get it started to reset to original settings so that we could return them.  Disappointing and waste of time. I will be hard pressed to ever purchase a product of any kind by this company....in fact, really how dare they even put out this garbage!?
Reviews.Title: Inferior in every way

Reviews.Author: Paula Stidman
Reviews.Content: It will be a gift to my Grand Daughter on December 25th so I don't know how it is.  I just know I got it for a great price and she wants it really bad so she will be thrilled.
Reviews.Title: She'll be thrilled

Reviews.Author: JOHNNIE WILLIAMS
Reviews.Content: Great..my mother loves it. I bought on for my sister also. Thank you. I think I will by more. Again...Thank you
Reviews.Title: one word.....WOW.

Reviews.Author: linda c wittemberg
Reviews.Content: However, the battery life could last longer. I'm not sure how to slow down the applications so the battery life is better.I was able to lower the screen brightness which is important. The Samsung Tab 2 lets you click on the house icon on the desktop and the application box comes up allowing you to slow it down. Theirs can stay on for atleast 24 hours. Mine doesn't last more than 4-5 hrs only if I don't use more than one application then it's less. Also, I had to downloan an ereader with a book shelf. Some tablets already come with these.But all in all it does the job for me. I can carry it around and view the things I need to, so not all is lost.
Reviews.Title: Overall it is a good tablet......

Reviews.Author: William Garrett
Reviews.Content: I simply did not enjoy this product. It has a hard drive and kept freezing and had to do a hard reset way too often.
Reviews.Title: Would not recommend
